Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ عَلَيْهِ اللَّهْوُ بَطَلَ جِدُّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is overpowered by amusement, his seriousness is nullified

Wisdom: نَكَدُ الْعِلْمِ الْكَذِبُ وَنَكَدُ الْجِدِّ اللَّعِبُ
enWisdom: The spoiler of knowledge is dishonesty and the spoiler of seriousness is idle play
The beginning of amusement is play and its end is war
Many a vain talk results in evil [action]
Many an amusement alienates a freeman

Wisdom: شَرُّ مَا ضُيِّعَ فِيهِ الْعُمُرُ اللَّعِبُ
enWisdom: The worst thing that one’s lifetime can be wasted on is idle sport
One whose amusement increases is considered a fool
One whose amusement increases, his intelligence decreases
Gatherings of amusement corrupt the faith

Wisdom: لَا تَقُولَنَّ مَا يُوَافِقُ هَوَاكَ وَإِنْ قُلْتَهُ لَهْواً أَوْ خِلْتَهُ لَغْواً فَرُبَّ لَهْوٍ يُوحِشُ مِنْكَ حُرّاً وَلَغْوٍ يَجْلِبُ عَلَيْكَ شَرّاً
enWisdom: Never say that which conforms to your vain desire, even if you say it playfully or assume it to be idle talk, for many a playful talk may alienate a freeman from you and [many] an idle talk may bring evil [consequences] upon you

Wisdom: لَا تُفْنِ عُمُرَكَ فِي الْمَلَاهِي فَتَخْرُجَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بِلَا أَمَلٍ
enWisdom: Do not waste your lifetime in useless pastimes, thereby leaving this world without any hope [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: لَا تَغُرَّنَّكَ الْعَاجِلَةُ بِزُورِ الْمَلَاهِي فَإِنَّ اللَّهْوَ يَنْقَطِعُ وَيَلْزَمُكَ مَا اكْتَسَبْتَ مِنَ الْمَآثِمِ
enWisdom: Do not let the transient world deceive you with its false amusements, for indeed its amusement ceases while the vices which you have acquired remain with you
